Difusión
Naming schema

http://geo.linkeddata.es/ontology/ClassName
(for Concepts)
http://geo.linkeddata.es/ontology/property
(for Properties)
http://geo.linkeddata.es/resource/InstanceName
(for data instances)
We agree to use the following prefixes:
@prefix geoes  <
http://geo.linkeddata.es/ontology/
>
Ontology

We have developed some ontologies that allows us to attached semantics to the publish data. The ontologias are:
top.owl
geometria.owl
geopolitica.owl
hydro.owl
transportes.owl
The ontologies sources are available on the SVN server at:
http://delicias.dia.fi.upm.es/repos/dataintegration/GeoLinkedData/ontology/trunk

Services

SPARQL

Endpoint:
http://geo.linkeddata.es/sparql
Query Examples:
SELECT * WHERE {{?x rdf:type <
http://geolinkeddata.es/ontology/Rio
>} UNION {?x rdf:type <
http://geolinkeddata.es/ontology/Embalse
> }}
SELECT ?x ?long WHERE {?x rdf:type <
http://geolinkeddata.es/ontology/Laguna
> . ?x <
http://geolinkeddata.es/ontology/longitud
> ?long. }
Server

Hosted @
girtab.dia.fi.upm.es
Configuration Diagram

Apache

Apache web server is used to handle the HTTP access to the different services that we provide. For instance,
http://geo.linkeddata.es/sparql
is served by virtuoso's SPARQL service located at
http://localhost:8891/sparql
.
The configuration for the GeoLinkedData project is located in
/etc/apache2/sites-available/geo.linkeddata.es
Virtuoso

Virtuoso
is a enterprise server for data management. It combines functionality to store and access to data in both the relation model and RDF. The RDF store provides support for SPARQL 1.1.
See Also:
Servidor_girtab#Virtuoso
Current installation

Path: /opt/virtuoso/geo.linkeddata.es/
HTTP Port : 8891
iSQL Port : 1112
MaxNumberOfBuffers: 100000 (Aprox. 781Mb of available RAM)
Conductor Access
Conductor is the management interface of Virtuoso. It can be accessed using the following:
URL :
http://geo.linkeddata.es:8891/
Username : dba
Password : geo8
Configuration

The main configuration of each virtuoso instance is in the
virtuoso.ini
file located in the
bin
directory of the instance. For geo.linkeddata.es the config file is in :
/opt/virtuoso/geo.linkeddata.es/bin/virtuoso.ini
Pubby

Pubby
is a frontend for LinkedData, providing content-negotiated representations of resources. It renders resource information obtained from a specified SPARQL endpoint. Pubby is implemented as a java webapp. The instalation is just a matter of deploying the WAR file into a servlet container such as Tomcat.
GeoLinkedData branch

We have made some modifications to Pubby in order to meet some of the requirements of our project.  Our Pubby branch is located on the SVN server at :
http://delicias.dia.fi.upm.es/repos/dataintegration/pubby-geolinkeddata/trunk
Related tickets:
http://trac.alexdeleon.name/geolinkeddata/ticket/26
http://trac.alexdeleon.name/geolinkeddata/ticket/40
Installation

Check out the sources from the
SVN repository
Build WAR by running the command
ant war
on the directory where the sources are downloaded. (Need to have
Ant
installed)
Deploy WAR on
Tomcat
using the
manager interface
(credentials are in
Servidor_girtab#Tomcat
)
Current installation

/opt/apache-tomcat-6.0.26/webapps/pubby-0.3-geo.linkeddata.es/
Configuration

Pubby has a configuration file for specifying the SPARQL endpoint to use, as well as, the URI patterns for resources. This file is located at:
${PUBBY_INSTALLATION}/WEB-INF/config.n3
. Instructions on how to configure this file can be found in:
http://www4.wiwiss.fu-berlin.de/pubby/
There is another file to specify metadata information. This file is located in:
${PUBBY_INSTALLATION}/WEB-INF/templates/metadata.n3
. More information about Pubby metadata extension at:
http://sourceforge.net/apps/mediawiki/trdf/index.php?title=Pubby_Metadata_Extension
More detailed documentation available on
File:Pubby.pdf
Browser

The GeoLinkedData browser is an in-house-developed-tool for visualization of data published by this project. The software is developed as a Java webapp and deployed on the
server's Tomcat installation
.

Sources

Liferay

Port: 8080
Path: /opt/liferay-portal-5.2.3
init.d script: a_portal
Deleting a graph (Dataset)

In order to obtain a list of the current graphs, execute:
$ /opt/virtuoso-scripts/lsgraphs.sh 1112
To delete a graph, execute:
$ /opt/virtuoso-scripts/deletegraph.sh 1112 {GRAPH_NAME}
How to load new data?

Place the RDF/XML file in /opt/data/geo.linkeddata.es/rdf/
Execute /opt/virtuoso-scripts/loadrdf.sh passing as arguments the path to the RDF file and the URI of the graph where the data will be loaded. For example:
$ /opt/virtuoso-scripts/loadrdf.sh 1112 /opt/data/geo.linkeddata.es/rdf/myfile.rdf
http://example.org/mygraph
(If the file is in NTriples or Turtle format then use the /opt/virtuoso-scripts/loadnt.sh instead)
